answers.answer: Hi,It will help us to know if your daughter has been evaluated for high BP, diabetes and high cholesterol. These are risk factors for white matter disease and affect its progression.It is really difficult to give an opinion without looking at the results of her investigations and clinical exam. It will also help to know the medication history and is there any relief in symptoms with them.I would suggest you to seek a second opinion with a neurologist. Thanks
Every time she has been to the doctor, her blood pressure is normal, diabetes is in her paternal side, but she does not have it yet...and the cholesterol, I would say she has not been checked.

Hi,Thanks for the update. I would suggest you to try alternate therapies for your daughter like acupressure or acupuncture or biofeedback since the medications are not working. Most of the pain medications if taken for too long can cause rebound headaches.Also make sure that she eats on time, sleeps on time and does some deep breathing exercises everyday. Hope this helps!

question: My 16-year-old daughter has had a 'chronic daily headache' since May 2...that would be 84 days today.  We have seen a neurologist, physical therapist, dentist, eye doc, er doc.  We've had scans that say everything is 'okay'.  there was some mention of white matter disease and the cerebral tonsils that don't protrude far enough to be considered bad.  This headache started around 8:30 pm and has never, never gone away.  She's been on 12 different meds, has pain now all over her body.  She was an "A" student involved with everything and a social butterfly.  Here we are a month from school starting and we are no closer to an answer than we were in May.  Please help!
title: Is there any help out there?
